localize.title: The New York Times Trends
localize.description: See what's buzzing on The New York Times in your native language

nodes.title: An anime convention held in Manhattan last November was not a superspreader event, a new CDC study found. Good air filtration, widespread vaccination and masks indoors prevented the 53,000-person event from causing a major Covid outbreak, the agency said. https://t.co/IT2ZIZVXgk
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: An Omicron subvariant that scientists believe is even more contagious is on the rise, the WHO said. It has become dominant in several Asian countries, but a decline in coronavirus testing is muddling the global picture. https://t.co/2UXsrBT3m1
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Spotify lured Joe Rogan with a $200 million deal, double initial reports. It made the company a podcasting giant. But controversy followed, putting the company at the center of a fiery debate about misinformation and free speech. https://t.co/gOsaKRKYmr
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: The New York attorney general Letitia James can question Donald Trump and two of his children in a civil inquiry into his business practices, a judge ruled, rejecting Trump's effort to block the questioning. https://t.co/dgCGpnYZvc
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Kamila Valieva, the Russian figure skating star who is at the center of doping questions at #Beijing2022, was expected to win the womenâ€™s individual event.

But after stumbling and falling during her routine, she finished fourth.
https://t.co/5IMXWueiQC https://t.co/zkuwC9gFoE
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A 13-year-old girl was held in a juvenile-detention center for 11 days after a classmate impersonated her on social media to make threats against their school. Now, her family has filed a lawsuit against the school and Instagram for failing to protect her. https://t.co/RwxMVSpfwO
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Police are threatening to arrest protesters blocking roads in Canada. U.S. truckers are planning their own protest. @sheeraf discusses the situation with @SarahMaslinNir in Ottawa and @porterthereport in Toronto. Join us now. 
https://t.co/tkEOXEBxAa
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Canada: The new Olympic champions in women's ice hockey. ğŸ’

The Canadians beat the U.S. in the gold medal game, 3-2, reclaiming the Olympic crown that the Americans had earned four years ago. https://t.co/xlzt7zlSpm https://t.co/vadM4UDwSE
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A private equity investor who paid more than $1.2 million to secure the admission of his three children to elite universities as purported athletic recruits was sentenced on Wednesday to 15 months in prison. https://t.co/5oFzDfPNe4
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Breaking News: A senior U.S. official accused Russia of lying about its pullback, saying Moscow added over 7,000 troops to Ukraineâ€™s borders in recent days.
https://t.co/DWoX7ggKHz

nodes.title: Breaking News: San Francisco voters ousted three members of the Board of Education in a recall election fueled by pandemic anxiety and anger. https://t.co/xmPEjL7G2O

https://t.co/tkEOXEBxAa
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Tuesday's cyberattack on Ukraine's defense ministry, army and banks was the largest of its kind in the country's history, a Ukrainian official said. And the head of the cyber security department of Ukraine's intelligence agency said Russia was to blame. https://t.co/sYp3JuIiO7
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The 15-year-old Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva said she was taking substances to treat a heart ailment. But experts say two of the drugs detected in her blood aren't regularly used in cardiology. https://t.co/FAMskbOe1t
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Infants whose mothers received two doses of an mRNA vaccine during pregnancy are less likely to be hospitalized for Covid in the first six months of life, a CDC study found. https://t.co/xSESfx2RXK
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
An investigation was launched after a Harvard University graduate student accused a professor of sexually harassing her. What happened next stunned her.

Harvard obtained her therapy notes and gave them to the professor, according to a lawsuit.
https://t.co/X58Uo6dx3v
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Breaking News: President Biden, rejecting Donald Trumpâ€™s executive privilege claim, is ordering the release of White House visitor logs to the Jan. 6 panel. He informed the National Archives that the logs should be turned over within 15 days.
https://t.co/HHx3ORSA0N
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: ValÃ©rie PÃ©cresse, a candidate for president of France, used the phrase "great replacement," referencing a racist conspiracy theory, in a speech over the weekend, fueling criticism from both her opponents as well as allies within her party. https://t.co/c7zxpRNko3
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Our bodies were â€œnot designed for the kinds of stressors that we face today,â€ a social psychologist said. Hereâ€™s how to recognize burnout in your body and what to do about it. https://t.co/D5OsMmgLHJ
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Why are truckers blocking roads in Canada? What's happening now? Will the protests spread to the U.S.? @sarahmaslinnir is on the scene and will discuss the latest developments with @porterthereport and @sheeraf on Wednesday, Feb. 16, at 5 p.m. ET. https://t.co/tkEOXET8rI
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Coachella will not require attendees to wear masks â€” or be vaccinated or tested for the coronavirus â€” when the festival returns for the first time in two years this April.
https://t.co/Q9nhHL0U5a
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: A woman of mixed race appears to be the third person ever to be cured of HIV, using a new transplant method involving umbilical cord blood that could make a cure available to more people of diverse racial backgrounds, scientists announced on Tuesday. https://t.co/kuGXmL94oZ https://t.co/IeYO4grOIB
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
The pastor of a Catholic church in Phoenix incorrectly performed thousands of baptisms over more than 20 years by changing one word in the ritual, a church investigation found.

â€œI deeply regret my error,â€ said the pastor, who has resigned. https://t.co/51WIi3lhr7
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Our bodies were â€œnot designed for the kinds of stressors that we face today,â€ a social psychologist said. Hereâ€™s how to recognize burnout in your body and what to do about it. https://t.co/gWo8beBfLe
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The U.S. government has requested the arrest and extradition of Juan Orlando HernÃ¡ndez, the former Honduran president who has been accused in New York of receiving money from drug cartels. https://t.co/fLZHnulgXJ
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: The Russian figure skater Kamila Valieva had other drugs that can be used to treat heart conditions in her system before the Olympics. Only one is banned, according to documents reviewed by The New York Times. https://t.co/grTlko0msR
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Dennis Hope has spent 27 years alone in a Texas prison cell smaller than a compact parking space. Last month, he asked the Supreme Court to consider setting limits on prolonged isolation under the Eighth Amendment, which bars cruel and unusual punishments. https://t.co/OuUHz6IdYH https://t.co/xFWd6LMQMy
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: A woman of mixed race appears to be the third person ever to be cured of HIV, using a new treatment that could make a cure available to more people of diverse racial backgrounds, scientists announced on Tuesday. https://t.co/MlDn6pazHl
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The Royal Canadian Mounted Police said it arrested 11 people and seized a cache of weapons â€” including long guns, handguns, a machete, body armor and a large quantity of ammunition and magazines â€” linked to protesters at a border crossing in Alberta. https://t.co/jwTClIBaQe
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Breaking News: Prince Andrew settled a sexual abuse lawsuit with Virginia Giuffre, one of Jeffrey Epsteinâ€™s accusers, according to a new court filing in Manhattan on Tuesday. Financial terms were not disclosed. https://t.co/TYOu3UhnuX
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Novak Djokovic is prepared to miss the French Open, Wimbledon and other tennis tournaments if a Covid vaccine is required to compete, he said in a BBC interview. Being free to choose what goes in his body is â€œmore important than any title,â€ he said. https://t.co/QjkmSbO0yx
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title:
Breaking News: Russia said some troops were being pulled back from around Ukraine, a sign of potential de-escalation. But large-scale drills are continuing.

Follow live updates. https://t.co/npIFp9pzqj
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Peter Thiel, one of Donald Trumpâ€™s biggest donors in 2016, is now a key financier of the MAGA movement. The tech billionaire is backing 16 Senate and House candidates, many of whom have embraced the lie that Trump won the election. https://t.co/bWwv5brH2H
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: New York City fired 1,430 city workers â€” less than 1% of its workforce â€” on Friday for failing to comply with its vaccine mandate. https://t.co/a4KbtTiRLY
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Adam Rippon, the Olympian who is now a coach, criticized the decision to let the Russian skater Kamila Valieva compete, saying postponing the team figure skating medals ceremony "robbed" athletes and those who helped them succeed of the podium experience. https://t.co/syuyslXTl3
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: Leaked data said to be from a crowdfunding platform that was posted by hackers suggests many of the larger donors to the Canadian trucker convoy are wealthy Canadians, though one of the biggest donations was made in the name of an American tech billionaire.https://t.co/rXjnV1FvKX
nodes.author: The New York Times

nodes.title: The American sprinter Shaâ€™Carri Richardson, who lost her spot on the U.S. team for the 2020 Summer Olympics after she tested positive for marijuana, questioned why the Russian skater Kamila Valieva could compete after failing a doping test. https://t.co/guV7BX6mdv

nodes.title: A 35-year-old woman was killed in her Manhattan apartment by a man who followed her into her building, the police said. Identified as Christina Yuna Lee, she was the latest person of Asian descent injured or killed in a string of attacks in New York City. https://t.co/S3PK7rEyHx
nodes.author: The New York Times
